title: Samsung’s decision to drop the “Z” from its foldable branding is a welcome change that I hope persists
content:
Smartphones are everywhere, and smartphone brandings are everywhere too. And I mean the latter in less of an “omnipresent” sense and more of an “all-over-the-place” idea. Because of the super-commoditized nature of a smartphone, what we call every smartphone is as important as what that smartphone is. Names stick, and they accumulate reputation and identity

The post Samsung’s decision to drop the “Z” from its foldable branding is a welcome change that I hope persists appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Samsung has removed the "Z" from the Galaxy foldables branding in some regions, and we hope they do so in the rest of the world too.
